name: Mas Pomona

reviews.title: Oh to find praise which has not already been said
reviews.text: I guess there is a reason that its difficult (no impossible) to find something new to say to heap praise on Mas Pomona and its wonderful hosts David and Marianne. That reason is that there is simply no way to improve on perfection and that is what we experinced during our stay.

reviews.title: A Wonderful chic B&B in Provence
reviews.text: To say that David went the extra mile is an understatement....he went several so that he could ensure we could hire our motor scooter without any hitches. This involved 3 or 4 trips to the hire place and he did them all so graciously.

reviews.title: Delight in the Luberon
reviews.text: Just as everyone has stated the home is a warm, elegant, minimalistic, classy home with a great sense of utter relaxation and comfort. We loved the independence we found by staying in The Pink Lady which meant we could come and go without disturbing anyone else and also enjoyed a sense of privacy The outdoor kitchen is a God send for both dining and also for sharing conversation which flows freely. We only got to spend one night chatting to Marianne (who in case there is anyone on the planet who does not know) is about to become a grandmother (possibly to be known as Goddess....and quite rightly so). She is hilarious especially once she has spent a little time sampling wine in the interest of informing her guests of a good drop.

reviews.title: Simple but Lovely
reviews.text: The area is VERY central and far from anything ressembling industry, contrary to some ridiculous nonsense I read on Slow Travel which must have been written by some ill informed "gentleman". I suspect he may never have visited the area.

reviews.title: Cordiality and comfort in Provence
reviews.text: David sent us to a wonderful restaurant in the town where we had a simply delicious meal presented by a generous host. In fact there was nothing they were not prepared to do to keep their guests informed and enlightened including giving lessons in how to use a egg cup to an American couple......amazing.

This is the second time we've visited Mas Pomona and we can't say enough about this place. It's so beautiful there. The hosts are so welcoming, helpful and friendly...they almost make you feel like family! I think this is what will make your holiday so special, not to mention the beauty and tranquility of the place itself.
reviews.title: ANOTHER amazing time at Mas Pomona!!!

likes.liked: — the owners, the pool, the location, the rooms, the BBQ, the view...and everything else!`

reviews.text: The grounds are gorgeous, the rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated wtih huge walk in showers, the pool is stunning and the BBQ area is perfect for breakfast, dinner and evening cocktails while meeting other guests from all over the world.
reviews.title: fantastic rooms and lovely pool

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms, pool area and badminton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do yourself a favour and go experience the beauty of Provence at Mas Pomona! You will NOT regret it!
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!

reviews.text: We stayed at Mas Pomona for 5 nights in August with our 4 children and had a lovely relaxing time. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated and the pool and surroundings are perfect. The barbecue area means you can cook the occasional meal and Marianne and David have lots of suggestions of restaurants for lunch and dinner. We would happily stay again.
reviews.title: Two thumbs up for Mas Pomona

likes.liked: — Exceptionally helpful owners, spacious and nicely decorated rooms, breathtakingly beautiful region for sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a gem! beautiful place to stay, perfectly situated to explore the fabulous area of Provence.
reviews.title: Delightful!

reviews.text: We had a 4 night stay at Mas Pomona in the middle of September. The setting is beautiful, very quiet with the dramatic Luberon mountains as the backdrop. It's very quick to get to Cheval Blanc (a lovely village 10mins walk away) from the airport and access to the well known destinations of the Luberon and Provence is very easy, with most roadtrips being fairly short and with fantastic views along the way.
reviews.title: Hosts with the Most
Relaxing, classy, delightful...
reviews.text: The Mas itself is a credit to David and Marianne and their flair for design. Our room was very comfortable and clean with lovely view from both windows.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cooked a few times using the guests' outside kitchen ... what a barbecue!!
reviews.title: Delightful Mas Pomona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was a total suntrap and we all braved the (slightly chilly in Sep) pool. Had the weather been good everyday I'm sure we would not have strayed too far from the Mas at all.
reviews.title: Relax and enjoy

reviews.text: Mas Pomona's greatest assets by far though are it's hosts generosity and ability to make you feel completely at home. David and Marianne have such an understanding as to what the local area has to offer every type of visitor that nobody will go home disappointed.
reviews.title: Lovely days in Mas Pomona

reviews.text: Overall it was satisfactory, but nowhere near the very high expectations we'd built up from prior reviews. We stayed for 5 nights, occupying two of the 5 rooms. The refurbished property - comprising the house, walled courtyards and gardens, and pool area - was great. The hosts were very helpful and informative about ttd regionally. The immediate surrounds and grounds/orchard outside the walled areas were unkempt. The nearby village - relative to those in the region - is quite ordinary and ok for basics. Other comments would include:- 1. the breakfast starts from 9 am - in this region they pull stumps for siesta at noon till around 4pm, so by the time you've eaten brekkie etc and travelled its 10 to 10.30...just not enough time to get tuned in or get anything achieved etc esp if you are a first timer. 2. the breakfast itself was basic, fixed, and very monotonous...a slice of melon, 2 pieces of fr bread, one croissant and jam per person...every day. 3. No tv, no radio, no kettle/tea. 4. The rooms were spacious and very tastefully and appropriately done but the facilities were a tad on the spartan side. 5. Wi-fi is available but does not reach most rooms (and not the ones we were in of course!). 6. The lighting in the rooms is very subdued ..to the extent that you can just read in bed, but not if sitting on the couch for example. 7. The night time lighting in the carpark area and within some of the walled areas is nil/very poor. Its dark at night esp in rural areas! 8. The hot water delivery and overall water pressure in the shower and basin reduced to a persistent dribble in 'peak' times in one room.
reviews.title: Good - with areas for improvement
mas pomona a piece of "France Profonde" from M & S Beck Sydney Australia
reviews.text: We spent a fantastic few days at Mas Pomona early October in time to experience the autumn ambience of crisp mornings, sunny days and evenings spent by a roaring fireplace in the property's communal dining area/food preparation area.The autumn colours really enhaced the picturesque village of Cheval Blanc and the surrounding areas of the Luberon.

David and Marianne were wonderful hosts who were a goldmine of information on places to visit, scenic drives and excellent places to eat. They let us know when it was market day at pretty Isle sur Sorgue and advised us where to buy organic chicken to bring back to eat that evening .
reviews.title: Great location in a lovely b & b...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent wonderful days following David's suggestions regarding which villages to visit for that lovely french tradition of the long lunch. The nights we did not eat out we dined in with food and wine we had purchased that day from one of the villages we visited. The communal outdoor dining area complete with fireplace , sink , cutlery and crockery made dining in a pleasure and felt like a home away from home. with views into a gorgeous courtyard and garden.
reviews.title: Too good to be true? No, really that good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mas Pomona was the ultimate B and B and you would be hard pressed to find anything better. It was in a very central location to explore all of Provence. It was beautifully renovated and tastefully furnished with a provencal simplicity. It was obvious that it is a labour of love for its proud owners.
reviews.title: Very relaxed stay

likes.liked: — Very clean and stunningly well put together

description: Mas Pomona is a charming bed and breakfast accommodation in a tranquil setting of four and a half acres amongst apple orchards at the foot of the Luberon mountains in the heart of Provence. It is close to the famous hill villages; Gordes, Lacoste, Bonnieux, Menerbes and Lourmarin and conveniently situated for the towns of Aix en Provence, Avignon , Isle sur la Sorgue and the Carmargue. The village has 2 restaurants and 2 bars and is "Real Provence", stay awhile and enjoy.
